para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Comptroller” means the Comptroller of Maryland.
“Department” means the Maryland Department of Labor.

section.heading: Credit Allowed.
section.text: Subject to the limitations set forth in Tax-General Article, §10-742(c), Annotated Code of Maryland, a taxpayer may claim a credit against the State income tax in an amount equal to the amount stated in the tax credit certificate issued by the Department.

para.text: Application. An applicant shall submit:
A completed application to the Department on the form designated by the Department; and
Supporting documentation required by the Department.
The Department shall:
Approve applications during the application period;
Approve the application if the:
Application is complete; and
Applicant is determined to be eligible;
Disapprove the application if the:
Application is incomplete;
Applicant fails to provide sufficient information or documentation to determine eligibility;
Applicant provides the appropriate documentation but is determined ineligible; or
The funds available for that tax year are expended; and
Provide the applicant with written notice of the final disposition of the application within 45 calendar days.

section.heading: Income Tax Credits.
section.text: On approval of an application, the Department shall issue an income tax credit certificate.

para.text: A taxpayer allowed the credit shall claim the credit against the State income tax in the year in which the apprentice is registered as set forth in Tax-General Article, §10-742(a)(3), Annotated Code of Maryland.
A taxpayer allowed the credit shall claim the credit against the State income tax in the form and manner required by the Comptroller.

section.heading: Carryover of Excess Credit.
section.text: If the credit allowed to the taxpayer in any taxable year exceeds the total of tax otherwise payable for that taxable year, the business entity may apply the excess as a credit for succeeding taxable years until the full amount of the excess credit is used.

section.heading: Monitoring.
section.text: The Department may request additional documentation to monitor continuing eligibility.

para.text: This chapter remains in effect until the earlier of:
The date that funding for income tax credits ceases to be available; or
The Department shall issue final income tax credits based on available funds.
